Topic.Title: Sybil - A crackhead needs your help

Message.Msg: Sybil, have to disagree with regarding options driving the valuation of amzn. How could options drive this company to have a $120+ billion valuation? As far as I can tell, there are 2 things driving the price: 1) positive feedback... as the stock price increases, more people jump into the stock, which perpetuates further increases and 2) many investors believe that amzn will be able to continue to increase rev while increasing margins, thus its pe will decline because the "e" is going to go up. Once sales growth misses, or eps misses and investors come to believe that amzn won't be able to deliver earnings, amzn will crack. Anyone who buys puts (or calls) before the next earnings call will not influence the stock price. AMZN's results will impact price. AMZN reports on a Tuesday. My guess is AMZN misses eps by a mile and hits the rev estimate. I hope the puts pay off.

Topic.Title: Sybil - A crackhead needs your help

Message.Msg: Nas, there is no question that the institutions and insiders own AMZN and they are responsible for its valuation. As far as I can tell, AMZN's value is more story driven, than fundamental driven. The very smart folks that run these funds believe that amzn will continue to increase rev and eventually increase margin, thus justifying its current value. I don't for a second believe that there is some kind of conspiracy among the big institutions to drive up the stock price. I think Bezos has created a company that is great at satisfying customers and has woven an incredible story that institutions believe. I also think that it has had a long time to deliver on its promises and that the fundamentals should drive its value. If fundamentals did, AMZN would crack. We will see. By the way, I'm am not listening to Sybil for investing advice. However, even you have to admit, he's funny as hell!

Message.Title: John,
Message.Msg: dont stray from the hard road that you must travel by 'rationalizing' crack addict optionz use az temting az it may be. Sybil will try to explain and wish you well along the difficult, but rewarding journey to comming clean. You see, amzn started out at a run of the mill oversold short squeeze in 2010 az it pressed the 120 range which waz an astronomical valuation even at that price, but thats what short squeezez do. At the same time, bot having institutionz teamed up with the CBOE to lobby, legalize, and institute use of weekly optionz crack, which sheila baird gladly rubber stamped az an 'INVESTMENT VEHICLE' for this nflx, crm and many, many other pjgz. Bot runnerz quickly realized the addictive nature of this form of 'cheap' crack, and understood that with access to realtime data and control of a statistically significant portion of the underlying low float stox like amzn that their money in a normal short squeeze waz no longer dead money at the top of the squeeze... Bot runnerz realized that they could price and sell this weaponized drug to crack headz and kill them like clock work and get paid weekly on what otherwize would have been 'dead money' at the top of a squeeze. Much like in the movie batman, the dark night risez, They found that if they lowered crackheadz into a deep pit and allowed them to see the light of day that they would hold hope of escape and move on to freedom and richez. Needless to say many many many have died, and the few that survive and (the antagonist and batman himeself) were either permanantly damaged social psychopaths or had the powerz of a super hero. (ie a robot running institution could very well at some point buy optionz crack from a 'smart' retail seller of them and then un fvck in load their underlying holdingz and cash in the crack puts, putting the retailer seller to the option and destroying him). The length of detail addressing your attemt to rationalize option use would require much much more time and space. Sybil will try to help you in small dosez. That iz all you get for today. Moving to fast can confuse and discourage a former user and lead them a stray. Stay strong john. Stay strong. Be clean be proud. One day at a time. One foot in front of the other.

Message.Title: Nas - Question
Message.Msg: Nas, you have been a committed bull, and over the last couple of months, you've seen a $50+ rise in the stock price. If you're long, good for you!!! As far as I can tell, your basis for being a bull is 1) institutions control amzn and they won't let it go do and 2) technical project it will go up. What happens to the stock price if they miss eps by a mile??? And if they miss rev growth targets??? Will the stock price hold, let alone continue to increase. BTW, there are many reasons to think there will miss eps by a mile. They have been well documented on the board...

Nas has been an AMZN bull for at least a couple of years. It doesn't matter if AMZN misses eps by a mile. It's happened before, and the stock has gone up in response. BTW, there are many reasons, documented on this board, to believe AMZN will fall to under $50. Of course its all bs.

Message.Title: What top line revenue number does AMZN need . . .
Message.Msg: to post say - 27% yoy - quarterly revenue growth, anyone know? tough stock to game as many know, kinda like CRM - all revenue no margins - but heavily held and all about the future and growth. the new normal, transports to the roof, basic materials stuck in the mud for almost 2yrs., infrastructure crumbling, but consumer still consuming and boxes still being delivered . . . maybe need a few bridges collapsing before the new normal adjusts . . . can't believe this has a beta under 1 either . . .

Topic.Title: I have never seen a stock get a 'valuation hall pass' like this POS.

Message.Msg: For the last 8 years Amazon has had the highest customer satisfaction rating of all internet companies. What value should this be worth? It's not on the balance sheet. It takes more than calculating the PE to be able sucessfully trade amzn.

Bruce, how can you say that earnings don't matter??? AMZN's valuation has been story driven so far... meaning that folks are investing in rev growth (which has been incredible) and banking on AMZN being able to increase margins in the future. At some point, AMZN will have to show earnings. And if they miss by a mile, they will have negative earnings for CY2012. Share price will drop if that comes true. Just because the stock price has risen in the past doesn't mean it will rise in the future. Fundamentals will matter sooner or later. I bet sooner.

Topic.Title: What top line revenue number does AMZN need . . .

Message.Msg: On the summary page, you'll see a link to financials. Look at the income statements and go to the quarterly view. There you'll see that AMZN's 2011q4 rev was $17.4 billion. A 27% increase puts 2012q4 rev at $22.1 billion. If they miss this, watch out.

John , I'm not sure it matters. You see AMZN numbers get walked down into reporting every qtr to where they don't miss anyway. If you read the upgrades of the last two weeks, you see not any of them have expectations of earnings, so there's not a downside number that mattters to me nor has there been for the last year or so. And I don't think there's much of a change that they miss topline. They never have by any material amount. Bigger than that, it's about the spin and support to whatever AMZN reports and that is usulaly overwhelmingly bullish no matter what. That's why I call AMZN the most loved and supported stock in the Universe. If valuation, meant anything,probably would see it go from 40 to 300 to 1000 to 3000 PE that all keep shoritng against. How is one to say when or how that's gonna stop? Now? Why? Just saying. It's one of the "chosen ones" on WS right now and has been for 14 years. Sure it get pullbacks from time time , even some like to 170 from 246. But usally the get bought up while shorts time shorinting into the overavaluation argument. It's more about the reaction to the numbers with AMZN than what the numbers are themselves. And most times, those reactions are quite postiive again and again. Don't let me stop you if you wanna take a flyer but .... but know the hisotry of how the stock ticks. To see AAPL crack, while AMZN ticks on tells you the story is more that about sales and earnings numbers in my book, especially on a quarterly basis. . Best of luck on whatever you do.

the "PE" of AMZN has gone from 40 to 50 to 100 to 300 to 500 to 1000 to 3000 so far. It night even get to 'N/a'. And the stock is still well supported at alltime highs levels by the big money where the funds plus the founder own 89 % of the oustanding stock. That's why they love to "lend" it out on the "its' gotta go down sometime, GMCR and CMG or some other other one did....." Sure they did, but not on anyone's timeline, it's on the big money's timeline perhaps. That's my view on the meaningless of earnings in regard to AMZN or the number in general right now. Someday, yest, they will be pressured to show profits promised. But throw the dart guessing. It's always had a premium prices and a story to tell. More than ever today.

You have been right so far, no question... I can't help but believe that if AMZN misses eps by a mile, folks are going to realize that their business model can 1) deliver incredible rev growth and 2) no profits. If they hit $0.27 eps in q4, they will have negative earnings for 2012! If they miss by a mile, the story turns much uglier. They will have missed several quarters in a row and their 2012 earnings will be very negative. Assume for the sake of argument that they miss eps... how can AMZN maintain its current price?

"Assume for the sake of argument that they miss eps... how can AMZN maintain its current price?" I don't know... maybe by merely reacting like the last few misses to the botttom forbecasted, by having a blip down and then a grind back up to highs of AH, then going up the whole next day. There's no why or how to it in explaining it in terms of ripping apart quarterly numbers. YOu don't get to where PE doesn't matter if it did no? Go ahead and buy puts or short it if you think it's time that it will. The reactions havn't favored that since maybe one I've seen when it was 246 and corrected to about 168. I know this report there's "earningless" expectations. THat's what anlaysts have said. What if it's a one way street: they make money and the hype in media is laid on thick? Lol! it happens day in and day out with AMZN stock and documented here. And the shorts still are mystyfied. I'll say this: it'll matter when it matters. And its' all a guess. That's my view on how numbers mean nothing in the history of it: shorts have decided that they should into big money saying no again and again. I guess for you : have your number comparisons ready, see what they are, see how the stock reacts, and watch the support and spin to them. Gotta go now.

Topic.Title: Amazon's Low-Profit Margin Model Is Key To Future Growth

Message.Msg: Yahoo message boards are misleading. When you post, you click "long-term sentiment disclosure", but when it displays it just says "sentiment". Strong buy is my LONG TERM sentiment. My current sentiment of hold is because I already sold some at 260. Had I not sold any, I'd sell some now at 270. I would not buy at this price, I never buy at the all time high.

Topic.Title: Amazon's Low-Profit Margin Model Is Key To Future Growth

Message.Msg: So, after all, we are in agreement...AMZN is simply too pricey at this level...despite all future promises. I tell you what, if AMZN blows away earnings and guidance goes up, I'd buy with both hands ;)

Topic.Title: What top line revenue number does AMZN need . . .

Message.Msg: It's interesting to note that GOOG "soft pedal" on their revenues and EBAY provided a cautious outlook. With taxes going up, uncertainties abound, and a year of big revenue growth, I think the law of the large numbers will kick in and AMZN will provide a tepid guidance even if they beat the odds last quarter. All around me, folks are moving away from shopping on AMZN due to sales taxes. I know for sure that's the case for us. There are plenty of great online places without sales taxes. There is no need for AMZN for us.

Message.Title: AMZN Revenu
Message.Msg: Let's hear all the data points that may help us understand AMZN upcoming report for the past quarter and guidance for the next? We've seen quite a few data points that point to a challenging quarter for AMZN. Has anyone seen anything that points to a great quarter? Btw, I found a report from around 11/29 that says that AMZN S3 (one of their cloud services) lowered pricing by 24-28% ...that's huge
Comscore estimates yoy online commerce increased 13.8%, which is obviously lower than what amzn is expected to grow. Not sure if this # includes mobile commerce though.

"I am confused though... you write that the bots have run up the price. how exactly do bots run up amzn from the low hundreds to 270 in a couple of years. I don't get it?" Answer: by way of 'accomodative fed policy' of an extraodinary levelz through in the following order talf, tarp, qe 1, qe2, operation twist, qe 3 with operation twist, and now qe monthly for an 'extended period of time'. Banks and bot runnerz do not use their own money they use tax payer dollarz and credit bubblez that have since been monitized into the greatest, and unpayable, bond bubble of all time. A bond bubble where a non money making company like amzn scorez 3 billion dollarz of 2% 'high grade' bond money with a single page application and no verifiable meanz of paying back the 1st installment due in 2015. The underwriterz ( ms and gs ) that are now pumping the stock they recieved in fee for underwriting will soon become bashing bond bulliez taking ownership of amzn realestate assets for 40 cents on the dollar.... Amzn to the 2012 bond market bubble az iz the no doc immigrant landscaper that financed a no doc loan to the 2007 credit market bubble. Bernanke printed a new high at the mutitrillion expense of the bond market with the publics money and created an environment for the too big to failerz that no have less moral hazard then ever before... But you have amzn at 270.00, the sheeple drinking koolaid and everything iz 'all better', a 'return to normal' if you will. "Secondly, when amzn reports, how can the options influence the price more than the results of the report?" Easy answer: it iz obvious that fundementalz are currently disjointed from stock price (thats putting it nicely), so the stock floats in the 270 range and possibly a small bump to do a final ringing out of weak handed shorts, and definitly a mass killing of optionz crackheadz for easy money az the bots unload into the final ring out. If you "invest" 2k in a stok and lose 50% of it iz iz unusual, if you buy 2k worth of crackhead optionz and lose 70% of it then it iz normal. Thats all sybs has to say about your last comment. Travel the hard road, john stay clean. If you do not have the gun powder to trade the underlying security of a pig stok like amzn, then move on to a cheaper pig like crm.... Message.Title: Yo Tech....... You Really Need To
Message.Msg: Check out AZO. I think its a big bloated pig.

Ok Sybil, you make some good points. Problem is I still don't get it. It must be all those put crack hits I've done. They have shaved IQ points off my intelligence. In fact, I've gotten to the point where I've even dealt call crack and lost $$$. How many dealers do you know lose $$$? Back to the confusion... the first point you address is an asset bubble caused by easy fed money. The fed has flushed the system full of $$$ and that $$$ has to go somewhere. In this case some of the easy money has went to amzn. But I still don't see any relationship between option trading and the run up in amzn. If the run up is due to easy monetary policy, then the collapse will be swift, and I want to own puts when that happens (see the put crack addict is always chasing). Second, rather than options driving stock price, I think that amzn will miss eps by a mile and may even miss on rev. If this is the case, watch out below. Institutions will not be able to keep this thing up. You'll have hedge funds jump in short, you some institutions realizes its time to head for the exist and you'll see down-grades. If they just miss eps, I will keep a close eye on it. There are plenty of instances where an eps miss has caused a swift drop followed by reversion to its old price. Of course, this may be the delusional hope of a put option crack addict. We will see.

November 1-December 31 $37,170 $42,286 14% So, correct me if I'm wrong, but total retail sales went up 5B. AMZN last year rev was 17.43B. For them to hit 22.5B in rev this year, they would have to essentially grabbed essentially all the growth reported by Comscore and everyone else stay stagnant? Considering BBY reported gains in a number of places and ChannelAdvisor reported AMZN CA (lots of folks) spending dipped during a critical shopping period along with the fact they had to cut their cloud services (growth driver) by some 20-28%, I think the thesis that AMZN will missed revenue estimates is correct. Factor in that Bezos said AMZN does not optimize for margin, that means profits probably took a serious hit too...just to not lose sales somewhat? If AMZN revenues come in anywhere near 21B and with EPS almost certainly in the dump, I think we will be looking at a stock price below 200.
"What do trading godz dine on? " Poached eggs, caviar, leg of lamb, and the trade accounts of the disrespectful.

I think there is a good chance amzn misses rev too and I've done the same exercise you've done... Only I use a couple of different assumptions... First, the Comscore figure is for the US only. AMZN doesn't have get all of its incremental rev for the US market. Second, I think the Comscore figure is for people how buy through a pc, not a mobile device. If so, mobile $$$ isn't included in the comscore data. Also, they have fast growing non-retail businesses. This is a small piece of the total pie, but it will boost rev nonetheless. Clearly, amzn has a big hill to climb on the rev front. I hope they miss as I plan on holding a boat load of puts going into the earnings call. I'm much more confident they will miss eps by a wide margin. We will see.

what's the basis for your expected monster beat on eps? there is ample reason to believe they will fail badly on the eps front. the last 4 esp results: Dec 11 = 0.38 Mar 12 = 0.28 Jun 12 = 0.01 Sep 12 = -0.60 notice a trend??? how exactly are they going to hit 0.54??? Other reasons they won't: 1) operating and net margins are declining 2) they started to collect sales tax in CA, PA and TX 3) the holiday season has widely been reported as disappointing 4) competition has offered to match prices 5) yoy online sales growth is 14% --- amzn is expected to increase yoy rev by 27% 6) their rev growth is decelerating 7) the unit rev per shipment is declining while unit shipping costs are flat to up... thus negatively impacting margins 8) they have droped prices on their cloud services shall I go on??? the consensus eps opinion for the upcoming report is 0.27 (which is a yoy from of 0.11) they will miss the 0.27 as well. one more thing... even if they hit the 0.27 eps they will have negative earnings for the year.
